meanings.definition: To review or examine something before it is officially reviewed or examined.
meanings.sent1: I always prereview my homework before turning it in to catch any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She prereviews her notes before the big test to make sure she remembers everything.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to prereview the evidence in a silly hat for good luck.
meanings.sent4: Before making a decision, it's important to prereview all the facts like a detective solving a mystery.
meanings.sent5: Prereviewing your work can help you avoid errors and improve your final outcome.

meanings.definition: A review or examination that takes place before the official review or examination.
meanings.sent1: The prereview of the manuscript helped identify areas that needed improvement.
meanings.sent2: We had a prereview meeting to discuss the main points before the actual presentation.
meanings.sent3: The prereview of the movie was like a sneak peek before the grand premiere.
meanings.sent4: Attending the prereview felt like getting a glimpse behind the scenes of a big production.
meanings.sent5: The prereview gave us a taste of what to expect in the full review later on.
